args.natural_language_statement: Prove that in a metric space, S is closed if and only if every sequence in S that converges in X has its limit in S.

retrieved_examples.nl: In a topological space, closed set iff sequentially closed when first countable.

args.content:
import Mathlib
open Set Filter
open Metric

/-- Prove that in a metric space, S is closed if and only if every sequence in S that converges in X has its limit in S. -/
theorem is_closed_iff_seq_closed {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] {S : Set X} :
  IsClosed (S : Set X) â†” âˆ€ (u : â„• â†’ X) (x : X), (âˆ€ n, u n âˆˆ S) â†’ Tendsto u atTop (ğ“ x) â†’ x âˆˆ S := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib
open Set Filter
open Metric

/-- Prove that in a metric space, S is closed if and only if every sequence in S that converges in X has its limit in S. -/
theorem is_closed_iff_seq_closed {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] {S : Set X} :
  IsClosed (S : Set X) â†” âˆ€ (u : â„• â†’ X) (x : X), (âˆ€ n, u n âˆˆ S) â†’ Tendsto u atTop (ğ“ x) â†’ x âˆˆ S := by sorry

import Mathlib
open Set Filter

/-- Prove that in a metric space, S is closed if and only if every sequence in S that converges in X has its limit in S. -/
theorem is_closed_iff_seq_closed {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] {S : Set X} :
  IsClosed (S : Set X) â†” âˆ€ (u : â„• â†’ X) (x : X), (âˆ€ n, u n âˆˆ S) â†’ Tendsto u atTop (nhds x) â†’ x âˆˆ S := by sorry
